snippet: The European Court of Human Rights has upheld a French ban on wearing face-covering veils in public, rejecting arguments that the measure violates religious freedoms.
abstract: European Court of Human Rights upholds French ban on wearing face-covering veils in public, rejecting arguments that measure violates religious freedoms and bolstering opponents of strict Islamic dress in other parts of Europe.
lead_paragraph: The European Court of Human Rights has upheld a French ban on wearing face-covering veils in public, rejecting arguments that the measure violates religious freedoms.
